docs.snippet: Marketers trying to reach an increasingly fractured and fickle social media audience are struggling to make ads when one version may not work everywhere.

headline.print_headline: No Sound Needed: Producing Video Ads for Facebook’s Silent Screen
headline.main: Making Video Ads That Work on Facebook’s Silent Screen

docs.abstract: Advertising column; advertisers are experimenting with silent video ads, skipping catchy jingle and familiar voiceover to take advantage of Facebook's News Feed platform; marketing experts doubt ads will be very effective since most studies indicate consumers recall video ads with sound much more than those without it; trend shows how fragmented audience is forcing advertisers to put aside traditions and explore other means of reaching consumers.

docs.snippet: A viral video featuring a woman on Facebook Live shows just how contagious humor can be.

headline.print_headline: Chewbacca Laughs; The World Does, Too
headline.main: Break Out the Chewbacca Mask and You Won’t Laugh Alone

docs.abstract: Viral popularity of Facebook Live video of Candace Payne wearing Chewbacca mask is partially explained by her own laughter at situation; experts say clips featuring onscreen laughter, especially those made by amateurs, are contagious because they disarm and create unique sense of intimacy with viewers.

docs.snippet: A new kind of centralized media, and a new kind of power.
The new service from Facebook’s photo-sharing app will let people share photos and videos that have a life span of no more than 24 hours with friends who follow them.

headline.print_headline: Instagram Takes a Page From Snapchat  (and Takes Direct Aim at Its Rival App)
headline.main: Instagram Takes a Page From Snapchat, and Takes Aim at It, Too

docs.snippet: The Partnership on AI unites Amazon, Facebook, Google, IBM and Microsoft to ease public fears of machines that are learning to think for themselves.

headline.print_headline: Protecting Humans and Jobs From Robots Is 5 Tech Giants’ Goal
headline.main: Protecting Humans and Jobs From Robots Is 5 Tech Giants’ Goal

docs.snippet: Candace Payne became the toast of the Internet after she streamed video of herself on Facebook as she tried on a growling Wookiee mask in her car.

headline.main: ‘Happy Chewbacca’ Video Is a Conquering Force on Social Media

docs.snippet: The bride works at Facebook; the groom works at a General Mills plant.
Twitter news, including a prolific tweeter’s hiatus. Also: A human sacrifice is needed for Elon Musk’s Mars shot. By popular acclamation, it’s Farhad.
